channel.title: MIP specs on MIP specifications
channel.description: Recent content in MIP specs on MIP specifications

item.title: Flow in MIP Local
item.description: MIP Local is installed in participating hospitals and used to collect clinical data provided by the hospital. Only patients with consent are selected, and no data ever leaves the hospital premises.

item.title: Flow in MIP Federation
item.description:
MIP Federated brings together several hospitals and clinical data centers to build a Federation.

Data are collected at each hospital (clinical data) or clinical data centers (research data), then a user of MIP can query and do machine learning or statistical analyses but with the strong imperative that only data aggregates are exchanged between the hospital or data centers and the central node hosting the user-facing web site.

item.title: Data Capture input
item.description: Data Capture collects available data from hospital databases or research cohorts. In addition, clinical data are de-personalised to protect patient privacy. It should also track consent and trigger the appropriate mechanisms to remove data from the platform in case the patient has removed her consent. Ideal forms of data repository for MIP The MIP has been designed to support a very wide range of methods to gather data, however some datasets are easier to include in the MIP if they meet some criteria.

item.title: Data Capture output
item.description: The Data Capture should export its data into a folder made available to the Data Factory There are several options possible, to adapt to the local requirements: Depersonalised DICOM + EHR data export ├── DICOM │ └── 2016 -- yearly folder, date represents the date of export │ └── 20161029 -- daily folder, date represents the date of export │ └── scan_research_id -- see description below │ └── dicom_name_generated_01.dcm -- set of DICOM files │ └── dicom_name_generated_02.

item.title: Data Factory input
item.description: The input of Data Factory is the output of Data Capture. From Data Capture output specifications Depersonalised DICOM + EHR data export ├── DICOM │ └── 2016 -- yearly folder, date represents the date of export │ └── 20161029 -- daily folder, date represents the date of export │ └── scan_research_id -- see description below │ └── dicom_name_generated_01.dcm -- set of DICOM files │ └── dicom_name_generated_02.dcm -- set of DICOM files │ └── dicom_name_generated_03.

item.title: Processing pipelines
item.description: graph LR data_in(Anonymised data from Data Capture) data_out(Reorganised data) processing Reorganisation of MRI scans and EHR data] data_in -- processing processing -- data_out
